name: High Five
description: This drink is a little miracle in liquid prestidigitation: five ingredients (three of them alcoholic) getting together to assume the guise of an innocent cherry cola. That flavor profile was exactly the intention of the bartender Jeff Lyon, who set out to make an alcoholic cola that tasted like “more than the sum of its parts.”
recipeIngredient: 3 ounces Linden Street Old Brick Bitter or Dogfish Head Indian Brown Ale

recipeInstructions.text: In a cocktail shaker three-quarters filled with ice, combine all ingredients except the beer and orange wheel. Shake until chilled, about 30 seconds. Strain into a Collins glass filled with ice. Top with the beer. Stir briefly with a bar spoon to integrate ingredients. Garnish with orange wheel.
